channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Jet Engines Are Breaking Down. Their Manufacturers Are Raking In Cash.
item.description: Many in the aviation industry are railing against misaligned incentives in the engine-making business, which makes profit through repair-shop visits and spare parts.

item.title: Nvidia, AMD, Apple and other tech titans must prove that AI investment is boosting earnings
item.description: Is Alphabet’s stock price drop — partially due to rising AI costs (and little income) — a sign of things to come?

item.title: Big Pharma Rallies and Moves Past Obesity
item.description: The rotation into laggard pharmaceutical stocks is being helped by optimism over regulations.

item.title: Occidental unveils $970 million worth of asset sales as it works to reduce debt
item.description: The Warren Buffett-backed company is selling about 27,500 net acres in the Barilla Draw Field of the Texas Delaware Basin and about 2,000 net acres in the New Mexico Delaware Basin, with combined net fourth-quarter production estimated at about 15,000 barrels of oil equivalent a day.

item.title: In a Troubled Box Office, Premium Still Sells
item.description: “Deadpool & Wolverine” is bringing crowds back to theaters. For IMAX, they never left.

item.title: Some $6 trillion of funds are about to shift — and here’s where they may end up
item.description: Strategists at UBS led by Matthew Mish say corporate debt will benefit when fund flows begin to shift.

item.title: Investors Embrace Bond Funds Before Rates Start to Fall
item.description: Fixed-income exchange-traded funds collected more money than ever during the year’s first half.

item.title: ‘She’s a danger to herself’: Our late brother left us $3 million, but my sister is in hospital with schizophrenia. Should I take control of her finances?
item.description: “At the moment, we are both in Florida, but the inheritance is in a California probate court.”

item.title: Luxury Brands Are in a Winner-Takes-All Phase
item.description: Hermès captured the lion’s share of growth in luxury-goods spending in the second quarter, while everyone else lagged behind.

item.title: Abbott Labs, Reckitt see further stock-price pressure after $495 million jury award
item.description: U.K. consumer-products giant Reckitt saw its share price slump after a jury awarded $495 million in a key baby-formula case.
